1 Corinthians__09.5__A woman, a sister: : Some erroneous translators have corrupted this text by rendering it, a sister, a wife: whereas, it is certain, St. Paul had no wife (chap. 7 ver. 7, 8) and that he only speaks of such devout women, as, according to the custom of the Jewish nation, waited upon the preachers of the gospel, and supplied them with necessaries.
1 Corinthians__09.16__It is no glory: : That is, I have nothing to glory of.
1 Corinthians__09.27__I chastise: : Here St. Paul shews the necessity of self-denial and mortification, to subdue the flesh, and its inordinate desires.
